intro: Potentilla breisnii, commonly known as the Alpine cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees. Its leaves are compound, with five leaflets that are typically oval and hairy. Potentilla breisnii thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is adapted to harsh mountain environments.
